text: this video is sponsored by
radio-controlled classifieds calm back
in 2009 I built this wacky flying sled
that was a whole lot of fun to fly
especially in deep snow recently I
decided to recreate it so I built two
versions one has an NT M 1200 kV motor
with a nine-inch Carbon prop and a 1300
milliamp-hour 3s lipo the other is a
lighter version with a 1200 KB blue
wonder motor a nine-inch prop and a 500
milliamp hour 3 s lipo this version also
has wider skis for powder snow and a
3-axis gyro receiver both are made
completely from 6 millimeter depron and
have a carbon rod on the leading and
trailing edges
the heavy version weighs fourteen point
three ounces or 405 grams and the
lighter version weighs ten point five
ounces or 300 grams here are some
in-flight video
Oh
you
service
Oh
Oh land on the roof
Oh
great
ha
yeah
one of the cool things about these sleds
is that they can utilize the ground
effect to travel very efficiently if you
throttle up to a decent speed and then
lower the throttle so that it doesn't
take off the sled will trap a bubble of
air underneath it and just kind of skim
along the ground with very minimal
contact to the snow I'd like to explore
this concept more in the future and
create a designated ground effect
vehicle similar to this but different
compared to a normal airplane these
sleds don't fly well at all they are
always at a high angle of attack which
makes them fly really slowly if you cut
the motor and try and glide it'll get
terrible winged Rock and eventually flip
upside down the three axis gyro receiver
I have on the light sled makes a huge
difference with this here's a glide in
comparison with the gyro both on and off
that was a shot this is with gyros on
I would not recommend this plane for
beginner pilots because the list of
weird flight characteristics is really
long however with a three axis gyro
receiver it becomes pretty easy to fly
when it's cruising along at high alpha
really slowly it's probably one of the
easiest planes to fly but it's just when
you get into sticky fly situations that
it's really difficult if you're a pilot
with intermediate skill level I would
definitely recommend using a gyro if you
are interested in building one of these
flying sleds click on the link in the
description thanks for watching bye
